data.title: Wedding weekend
data.text: Very conveniently located in the historic district. We were able to get to the hair salon and Pulaski square easily for the wedding.  Concierge was extremely kind and helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was hot and delicious. Would stay again!

data.title: Could have been cleaner
data.text: This is an old hotel but it could use a little more cleaning.  The rate is reasonable especially when you consider the location to the historic community. The breakfast is average for a free hotel breakfast.  I would stay here for one night but not any longer. The bathroom walls were covered in hair and the mirrors were smeared and dirty looking. My sheets were worn and had stains.

data.title: Birthday
data.text: We paid 200$ for room and was then charged 10$ to park in facilty parking lot!!! That's absurd!!! Why charge someone for staying in your hotel?!!!¡;;;;  When I asked desk clerk, they couldn't explain it either

data.title: Overnight fun
data.text: Great overnight stay. Nice view from hotel room window. Quiet with nice breakfast. Pool was decent. Pick up van was offered. Bicycles available to rent. Walking distance to downtown area if you like to walk.

data.title: Stay in savannah
data.text: The hotel is clean and staff was extremely helpful.   They are two blocks from the historic district.  They are on the extreme edge not in the historical area.   Also the spa wasn't working when we stayed here.  Not impressed.

data.title: Enjoyed all the Special Touches!
data.text: We were very pleased with the spacious suite and its high ceilings, the very helpful concierge (a retired Kindergarten teacher), the friendly front desk staff, the accommodating shuttle drivers, the walking distance to the Historic District BUT absolutely delighted when talented  local entertainers surprised us at breakfast with their impersonations of Forrest Gump, Johnny Mercer, and a ship's captains wife. Great fun!

data.title: Interesting location!
data.text:
Great to be able to walk back from the Historic District after a whole-day walking tour.

Dropped off at Forsyth Park by the hotel shuttle service and then enjoyed going through the squares in all directions taking in the architecture and landscape.
What a great day!

Hotel staff at reception and visitor relations real helpful.

Hotel a bit off path but not problematic

data.title: Check in was a nitemare!
data.text: It took over an hour to get checked in.  One desk clerk, one computer down.  I had a room and my brother had a room.  Each of us was charged for parking.  We only had one car.  Check your bill carefully!  The pool/sauna was down and never fixed during our 3 day stay.  The pool was one of the reasons we chose this hotel.  Asked if there was coffee available Clerk said "over there.  if there is any."  Front desk clerks were not friendly at all.  Upon entering or exiting the hotel, they never glanced up even when a friendly "Hi" was given.  This Comfort Suites does not live up to the standard of the many others I have stayed at.

data.title: Great location
data.text:
This nice hotel is simple but with all you need when you visit this amazing City. The staff was very nice and friendly. Important to mention Jeanne at the concierge desk, she was more than attentive, friendly, a real southern sweetheart.
Place was clean, comfortable beds and good size rooms, good and complete included breakfast Location is excellent, about two block from the center of the main action.
You have to pay a separate fee for parking your car which is not really correct but everything else outweighs that.

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: Clean, large rooms.  Good location with shuttle service to downtown although walkable from the hotel.  Very good hot breakfast.  Friendly, helpful folks behind the fron desk. I would recommend this hotel.

data.title: Just great
data.text:
The building and quality of room is what we are use to from Comfort Suites! It is a couple miles out of river street however they have a shuttle that takes you there. I would definitely stay at this location again. Please be advised the charge 10.00 to park if you are an Elite member. If not Elite 20.00 
It didn't offend me , but the gentleman in front of me was offended that he wasn't told until he arrived.

data.title: Very nice hotel on outskirts of Historic District
data.text: This Comfort Suites is located on the edge of the historic district but it is only about a 5 minute walk to the City Market and Riverfront. The hotel itself seems somewhat newer and in very good condition. Our room was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable! The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is even a concierge in the lobby to help with planning your day. Your stay includes breakfast each morning. The breakfast selection was nice, fresh, and varied. Although we did not use them there is a small pool and hot tub. They also offer a free shuttle service within the historic district. Parking is normally $20/day but you can cut that in half just by signing up for the free Choice Rewards program prior to booking. We felt it was worth it since we never even moved our car the whole time we were there. Without question, we would stay here again. Be prepared though, prices in Savannah are higher than other cities for rooms and this hotel is no exception.

data.title: Best stay of 3000 mile trip
data.text: Two girlfriends and I visited Savannah and stayed at the Comfort  Suites. We had a delightful room but were most surprised and pleased by Miss Becki who was on staff to help us with our sightseeing questions. She gave excellent information. Then Jaynard and Fronz were there with the van to take us to and from our destinations--all courtesy of the hotel.  They did such an excellent job that we were lost at our next stay without them!  They made our time in Savannah our favorite stop of our 3000 mile trip! Thank you Miss Becki, Jaynard, and Fronz!

data.title: Great
data.text: We stayed here for 2 nights. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. Becki, the Concierge, did an awesome job!  She was SO helpful, and very pleasant. The free shuttle system worked very well, making it easy to get around in Savannah. We got a 2 day pass on the Old Town Trolley. You could get by with a one day pass- and go on their 1 1/2 hour historic tour. The next days you could use the free DOT bus system which goes almost the same routes as the trolley- you just don't get the historical monologue from the bus driver. The room was on the first floor and had at least an 18' ceilings..... so room was very quiet. The complimentary breakfast was OK- nothing exceptional. We were charged an extra $10 a day for parking at the hotel. I would recommend the Comfort Suites.

data.title: Excellent! !
data.text:
My wife and I decided to go on vacation to Savannah after reading Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil.
 After reading reviews on Trip Advisor we took a chance on this hotel.  It was a chance well taken. It is close to the airport and close to the historic district. There are 5 things that make this hotel stand out; (not necessarily in order) 1- Value, 2- Clean, spacious rooms, 3- Concierge,  4 - Friendly staff, 5 - The shuttle. 
There is a concierge in the lobby where you can book tours, get recommendations, or simply ask for directions.  The shuttle will take you and pick you up anywhere within the historic district, which is extremely convenient. 
Breakfast is served from 0600 to 1000, which is run of the mill fare, waffles, scrambled eggs, and either ham, sausage, or bacon. Also cereal, and pastries. 
The only gripe I have is the parking fee; $20.00 a day, or $10.00 a day for Choice Rewards members. But having said that, I highly recommended this hotel.

data.title: Horrible Stay and Customer Service
data.text:
The hotel reservation staff member initially did not honor the rates I was given when I booked via Expedia.com. I was told that I had to prove to her the rates when I booked per Expedia. When I asked to speak to the "acting manager", he upheld the clerk’s actions, by saying that he's had trouble with Expedia and that they've asked many guests to show their reservation letters to prove their rates. 

There was only one shuttle bus. On Friday night we called twice over a span of 20-minute intervals requesting a pick-up to return to the hotel room. We were never picked up, we ended up walking 4-5 blocks back to the hotel. 

On the last night of our stay, I realized that my card had now been charged four times inappropriately.  When asked for an explanation of this matter by the “acting” manager, she replied "ma'am I can't tell you what happened". She never attempted to resolve this matter or promise to follow-up to find out the cause of the error.

The room was not cleaned properly; upon entering the room, on the headboard of the bed were multiple finger prints. Also,while sitting in the hot tub all of 2 minutes, noticed a ring of dirt around the whole of the spa.

Our key cards kept malfunctioning. When we asked to have them re-coded, in essence we were scolded and told "you need to make sure that you don't have the card by your cell phone, credit cards”.

data.title: As close as you can get to the historic district without paying a fortune
data.text: We chose the Comfort Suites Savannah Historic District because we wanted a hotel that was within walking distance of Savannah's historic district. Though technically outside this district, and admittedly across the street from some rather dubious project development, we were able to walk to the center within about ten or fifteen minutes. In fact, the hotel has a first-come-first-served shuttle to take you there and back, but we preferred to take in the fresh air along the banks of the Savannah River. This is a good hotel, focusing very much of the tourist (there is even an agent in the hotel lobby). Our room was OK, but a little dated perhaps. We also detected a little damp in the room, although it was hard to pin down. My main disappointment was that the breakfast room was full when we went down in the morning, so we had to wait for a table. The breakfast food was also rather average. But on balance, with the friendly staff and close proximity to the historic district, this hotel was a good pick. (Note that there is a $20 parking fee.)

data.title: Great place to stay..good central location
data.text:
Very helpful staff.......room was very clean.........good price
Staff very knowledgeable on the history of the area.
The hotel offers breakfast
The hotel has a pool and hot tub
We will continue to stay there when we are in Savannah Ga.

data.title: Great city
data.text: Great hotel. They offer free shuttle to restruarnt, shopping, etc. Great service. Would book at this hotel again. Rooms clean and good and breakfast on par with other comfort suits. Location off from down town area but with shuttle it was no problem. They do charge for parking however. First choice hotel we ever stayed at that charged for parking overnight.

data.title: Perfetly located, enoyed the shuttle service
data.text: The room was great and quiet. The hotel has a great location, where you can either walk to the main areas or be transported by the shuttle service which is a great service! Both of the consierge was a great help. I would defintly stay here again.
